review: I bought this and so far I really like it, it is portable and small. I watch a lot of netflix on it. One thing that I have noticed about it is that it needs to load a lot. Several times per episode of shows I watch. It really doesn't take long for it to finish loading, but it can be a slight inconvenience. My boyfriends mom came over while I was using it and she noticed that it was doing that and she said that hers does that as well. Also, I have used mine in different places with different internet providers and it does it everywhere I have used it so I do not believe that is the issue.
author: Tonya

review: I have a slow internet service (DSL) - though I liked the interface & remote control - when compared with my Google stick - no comparison. Not sure how Google manages it but I get no latency watching Netflix. Using Amazon stick - Netflix was constantly stopping & downloading. I am one of few that still uses DSL - it satisfies my needs at a very low cost!

review: Such a shame.  With this device Amazon has decided to place their Prime content in their own sandbox for which I must condemn their action.  Data needs to be free! I bought this because a member of my household doesn't want to start the PS4 to watch Amazon Prime, and Amazon Prime isn't available to be cast to Chromecast or AppleTV for some reason.So now I have a Chromecast that I use for everything and Amazon TV Stick that I use for Amazon Prime content.There is ONE good thing about this device.  When it is setup, anyone on the network can use it - thank you for not making us sign in to different account credentials from different devices.But, please start playing nicely with Google devices and Apple devices and Roku etc. I shouldn't need to own this, but alas I do.
